title: Sri Lanka seeks second US$500mn oil credit from India: CPC
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka is seeking a second 500 million US dollar credit line from India as the island has almost finished the first credit line of a similar volume, Ceylon Petroleum Corporation Chairman Sumith Wijesinghe said.
Sri Lanka has rapidly used up the credit line as oil prices rose and power cuts and reduced furnace oil and naptha production at a domestic refinery, drove up diesel demand for power.
“We are in discussions with India for an oil credit of another U$500 million dollars,” Wijesinghe told reporters in Colombo.
An existing 500 million US dollar credit line from India was being used up quickly.
By end April about 375 to 400 million from the credit line would be used, he said.
Ceylon Petroleum Corporation was paying around 128 dollar per barrel for diesel and 121 dollar a barrel for petrol. (Colombo/Apr11/2022)
